solution.text:
Money spent on bus = cost per head of bus \(\times\) number of students = 100 \(\times\) _{j}_= Rs. _{{100*j}}_
Money spent on taxi = cost per head of taxi \(\times\) number of students = 200 \(\times\) _{k}_ = Rs. _{{200*k}}_
Money spent on auto-rickshaw = cost per head of rickshaw \(\times\) number of students = 150 \(\times\) _{{12-j-k}}_ = Rs. _{{1800- 150*j- 150*k}}_
Percentage of money spent on autorickshaw = money spent on rickshaw/total money spent \(\times\) 100
\( Percentage = \frac{_{{1800- 150*j- 150*k}}_}{_{{1800-150*j-150*k}}_ +_{{100*j}}_ +_{{200*k}}_} \times 100\)
Therefore, the percentage of money spent on auto-rickshaw is _{{trunc( ((1800-150*j-150*k)*100)/Decimal(1800-50*j+50*k),2 )}}_.

content.text: What percentage of the total money is spent on auto-rickshaw?
